oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Quantifying coherence of Gaussian states
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Xu, Jianwei
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Coherence arises from the superposition principle and plays a key role in quantum mechanics. Recently, Baumgratz et al. [T. Baumgratz, M. Cramer, and M. B. Plenio, Phys. Rev. Lett. 113, 140401 (2014)] established a rigorous framework for quantifying the coherence of finite dimensional quantum states. In this work we provide a framework for quantifying the coherence of Gaussian states and explicitly give a coherence measure based on the relative entropy.
